p: Free radical scavenging activity of the polyherbal formulas was assessed using DPPH reagent, and the activity was compared with that of the 0.5% DMSO vehicle control ( Figure 1). One-way ANOVA showed significant main effects for the group ( F = 36.3, p < 0.01). The post hoc test versus the vehicle control revealed significant decreases by 15.3% in BJ, 40.9% in PJ, and 21.5% in WR ( p < 0.05). The activity was a little reduced by 5.9% in OR; however, it was not significant.
